title: What Should an OMS Actually Do?
excerpt: Shopping baskets, not PNRs. Ann Cederhall clarifies what to look for when evaluating Order Management Systems for airline retail.
author: Retailaer
content:
From our reading list: When Ann Cederhall explains what an OMS should actually do, she focuses on outcomes, not buzzwords.

The core insight: an OMS provides significant advantages by centering operations around shopping baskets rather than PNRs. That means consolidating multiple bookings, enabling dynamic bundling, and applying unified business rules across orders.

This post provides a clear evaluation framework for any airline assessing their technology options.
